channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US intel: Did share info to foil alleged IS plot targeting Taylor Swift Concert
item.description: US intelligence aided in thwarting a planned attack by Islamic State sympathizers at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna. Three individuals were arrested and charged with planning a suicide attack. This successful intervention emphasised the importance of international cooperation in combating terrorism and safeguarding public events, as confirmed by the White House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Prince Harry thought King Charles would forgive him but ...': Expert
item.description: Prince Harry expected his father, King Charles, to make amends and forgive him, but tensions have instead heightened. Since Harry's departure from royal duties and his revealing memoir, Charles is reportedly furious and refuses to take his son's calls. The King is also concerned about potential future revelations from Meghan Markle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why are scientists proposing to warm up Mars, how will they do it?
item.description: Scientists proposed to introduce engineered nanoparticles into Mars' atmosphere to raise its temperature by 50 degrees Fahrenheit over ten years. These particles would enhance the natural greenhouse effect. The researchers believe warming Mars' atmosphere is a crucial step despite the planet's harsh conditions. They also stress the importance of studying potential unintended consequences, including the possibility of past or present life on Mars.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Watch: Female NYPD officer punched on face by 'repeat offender' at New York sidewalk
item.description: A female NYPD officer was assaulted by Ernst Delma, a repeat offender, on a Bronx sidewalk. The attack happened when the officer intervened in Delma's argument with children. She received facial injuries and was taken to the hospital. Delma was arrested and has a history of similar offenses. The incident raised concerns about criminal justice priorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK govt mulls curbs on visas for techies to bring down migration
item.description: The UK government considered tightening visa rules for foreign IT, telecom, and engineering professionals to address high migration levels. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper requested a review by the Migration Advisory Committee, focusing on sectors heavily reliant on international recruitment due to domestic skill shortages. The report is expected in nine months.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: ‘No excuses’: US & other mediators call on Israel, Hamas to talk truce on Aug 15
item.description: Leaders from the US, Egypt, and Qatar urged Israel and Hamas to resume talks on the Gaza conflict, emphasizing that only details of the ceasefire and hostage release need finalizing. Israeli PM Netanyahu announced that Israel's negotiation team will meet on August 15 to finalize the agreement details. Four or five areas of disagreement remain unresolved.

item.title: Yunus to meet slain student’s family
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, the head of Bangladesh's interim government, will visit Rangpur district to meet the family of Abu Sayed, a student killed in police firing during anti-reservation protests. Yunus hailed Sayed, citing his bravery as a catalyst for the revolution. Former PM Sheikh Hasina's visit to protest sites but not victims' families faced criticism.

item.title: Passenger plane crashes in Brazil, killing 62 on board
item.description: A plane operated by VoePass crashed near Sao Paulo, Brazil, killing all 62 people on board. The aircraft, an ATR 72, was en route from Cascavel to Sao Paulo before crashing in Vinhedo. The cause of the accident remains unclear. Footage shows the plane spiraling before hitting the ground, causing significant damage to nearby buildings. Brazilian aviation records show that the plane was manufactured in 2010, and was approved to carry up to 68 passengers.

item.title: US, other G7 nations shun A-bomb anniv in Nagasaki over Israel snub
item.description: Nagasaki commemorated the 79th anniversary of its WWII atomic bombing, but the event was marked by the absence of the US ambassador and other G7 envoys due to the city's decision not to invite Israel. PM Fumio Kishida reiterated his promise for a nuclear-free world, despite criticism. US ambassador criticized the exclusion of Israel, calling it a political decision.

item.title: Bangladesh interim govt takes shape, 27 portfolios with Yunus
item.description: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, assigned key ministries to various figures, including former foreign secretary M Touhid Hossain. Yunus himself took charge of 27 ministries, including defence and education. This new administration, formed through a student movement, announced no decision yet on its tenure length and aims for democratic reforms.

item.title: Iraq law proposing legal marriage age of girls to 9 years would 'legalise child .......'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump plane heading to Montana rally was diverted but landed safely nearby, airport staff says
King Charles' message amid far-right riots; 741 arrested, 302 charged, says UK police
item.description: King Charles has called for mutual respect and understanding following far-right riots in the UK targeting Muslims and migrants. The king thanked police and emergency services for their efforts. Over 700 arrests have been made, with charges filed against 302 individuals. Authorities remain on high alert for potential further unrest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance reveals how he lost 30 pounds in 2 years: He changed this meal
item.description: ​JD Vance's before and after photos reveal a great weight loss journey but the GOP vice presidential candidate said it was all natural and he did not take any drugs or medicine for weight loss. Two years ago, Vance embarked on this 'eat less and eat better' journey when he was out of breath while playing with his children. Vance told DailyMail that the election campaign may derail his diet and exercise regime and he may regain the weight he lost.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man who attacked police at the US Capitol with poles gets 20 years, one of longest January 6 sentences
President Joe Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris to make first joint trip since Biden dropped out
Old video of Kamala Harris struggling to charge electric vehicle viral: 'This is real'
item.description: As the presidential election campaign is at its peak with both Trump and Harris camps digging the dirt, an old video of Kamala Harris struggling to charge an electric vehicle is viral. The video dates back to 2021 when Harris was speaking with reporters at the Brandywine Maintenance Facility in Prince George's County. During the demonstration, she appeared flabbergasted charging the car.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman's body found entangled in baggage conveyer belt at US airport
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Swift Vienna concert attack: Third teenager arrested after attack plot foiled
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Naked US teacher saves girl from being sexually assaulted, watch
item.description: A middle school teacher in Texas saved a 15-year-old girl from an attacker in a gated Houston apartment complex. The incident occurred around midnight on July 28. David Garza, the teacher, responded to the girl's cries for help by confronting the assailant with a gun, preventing a potential sexual assault. Authorities are seeking public assistance to identify the suspect.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
